11.28.18  12:57 pm   Wow bill this is one of my all-time favorites from you! Your vocals sound really good in this one, especially in the higher register. I also appreciated the key change bridge part and the interesting rythym in the chorus (were those triplets? I'm not sure... oh wait did you switch the words from falling on the beat to being syncopated? Or vice versa? At any rate, an interesting rhythm). Embrightened is my new favorite word. Downloaded on iTunes and listening to it now. :)
11.28.18  12:48 pm   Is the london bridge falling down is refering to the UK leaving Europe? It's like the last part of the song only talks about trending event in a happy way

11.28.18  12:42 pm   Hello bill-for my music theory final we are composing a piece of music in any style that uses at least one major, minor, diminished, and augmented chord. I know and can play what each of these chords is, but I'm not sure where to go from here... so I make up a song and then work in whatever chords are not there, or do I start from the chords and make a song out of them? If I could I would just take what the chords feel like to me and how they work together and make a song perfectling meshing all their characteristics to make something new, but I'm not quite that experienced in songwriting yet, so I don't think I'm able to (if it happens like that, though, I will not object!). Suggestions?

11.28.18  10:54 am   whether "Christmas" is real or not, Jesus is not "still" Santa.
As a matter of fact, Santa is still satan. Figure it out. You're the anagram expert. How could you miss that?

Jk...

Lol! In all seriousness bill, that was a very cool and neat song. I love your choice of lyrics and chords and music, etc. I think the song gives a new meaning to the phrase "Christmas spirit"

How did you hit that F# in the beginning without flipping into falsetto? Do you have any vocal technique that allows you to hit high notes without straining?
